programme.title: Defeated by Naruto, Neji is being taken to the hospital, when Neji’s uncle Hiashi appears.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Sasuke’s match is postponed and suddenly, it is Shikamaru’s turn.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: In Shikamaru and Temari’s match, Shikamaru who had the upper hand suddenly makes a surprising decision!
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Sasuke and Gaara’a anticipated match begins. Gaara eerily talks to himself, as though addressing someone.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Sasuke's speed and moves are identical to Lee’s Taijutsu. But Gaara is not an opponent who can be defeated with just Taijutsu.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: During the match, someone has used Genjutsu to put everyone in the arena to sleep. The Sand Ninja led by Orochimaru have begun their plan to destroy the Hidden Leaf Village.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: The Sound and Sand Ninja, along with Orochimaru, begin their move to destroy Hidden Leaf Village. The arena has become a battleground.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Along with Pakkun, Naruto, Sakura and Shikamaru are in hot pursuit of Sasuke. Pakkun senses nine of Orochimaru’s men coming after them.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Orochimaru traps the Hokage inside a barrier and they continue to battle.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Sasuke finally catches up to Gaara, Temari, and Kankuro. Kankuro escapes with Gaara leaving Temari to face Sasuke.
programme.desc: Naruto

programme.title: Revolver, (2005, Action)
programme.desc: REVOLVER is populated with Guy Ritchie's (Snatch; Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels) classic breed of fast-talking, sharp-suited gangsters but with a psychological twist that your mind may not be able to handle.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction, (1994, Thriller)
programme.desc: Writer-director Quentin Tarantino delivers an iconic cast of characters in PULP FICTION, a wildly entertaining tale of violence and redemption. John Travolta, Samuel L. Jackson, Uma Thurman, and Bruce Willis star in this pop culture phenomenon.

programme.title: The Whole Nine Yards, (2000, Dark Humor & Black Comedies)
programme.desc: An unhappy dentist in Montreal gets a new neighbor, Jimmy 'The Tulip' Teduski, a former mob hitman turned informant with a price on his head.

programme.title: Along Came A Spider, (2001, Thriller)
programme.desc: After the harrowing death of his partner, detective and best-selling author Alex Cross has retreated to the peace of retirement. But when a brilliant criminal (Michael Wincott) kidnaps a senator’s young daughter, Alex is lured back into action.

programme.title: Stand Up Guys, (2013, Action)
programme.desc: Oscar winners Al Pacino, Christopher Walken, and Alan Arkin star in this action-comedy about retired gangsters who reunite for one last epic night.

programme.title: Killer Elite, (2011, Action)
programme.desc: A special-ops agent must rescue his mentor.

programme.title: Pulp Fiction, (1994, Thriller)
programme.desc: Writer-director Quentin Tarantino delivers an iconic cast of characters in PULP FICTION, a wildly entertaining tale of violence and redemption. John Travolta, Samuel L. Jackson, Uma Thurman, and Bruce Willis star in this pop culture phenomenon.

programme.title: Takers, (2010, Action)
programme.desc: After pulling off a spectacular series of bank heists, the TAKERS plan a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring them down.

programme.title: Hard Boiled [Cantonese-Language Version], (1992, Action)
programme.desc: A tough-as-nails cop teams up with an undercover agent to shut down a sinister mobster and his crew.

programme.title: The Master, (2012, Historical Drama)
programme.desc: Haunted by his past, WW-II veteran and drifter Freddie Quell (Joaquin Phoenix) crosses paths with a mysterious movement led by The Master (Phillip Seymour Hoffman) and his wife (Amy Adams).

programme.title: Capote, (2005, Biographical Drama)
programme.desc: In 1959, Truman Capote learns about the horrific and senseless murder of a family of four in Kansas. As he digs deeper into the story, he is inspired to expand the project into what would be his greatest work, In Cold Blood.

programme.title: Before The Devil Knows You're Dead, (2007, Crime)
programme.desc: Andy, an overextended payroll executive, lures his younger brother, Hank, into a larcenous scheme: the pair will rob a suburban mom-and-pop jewelry store that appears to be the quintessential easy target.

programme.title: Flawless, (1999, Inspirational Drama)
programme.desc: A tough, conservative security guard suffers a stroke during a bank robbery. His recovery requires voice lessons from his drag queen neighbor. The unlikely pair learn to look beyond their differences and find common ground in friendship.

programme.title: Doubt, (2008, Historical Drama)
programme.desc: A mesmerizing, suspense-filled drama elevated by four riveting Oscar-nominated performances from Meryl Streep, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Amy Adams, and Viola Davis, DOUBT will have you pinned to the edge of your seat.

programme.title: The Master, (2012, Historical Drama)
programme.desc: Haunted by his past, WW-II veteran and drifter Freddie Quell (Joaquin Phoenix) crosses paths with a mysterious movement led by The Master (Phillip Seymour Hoffman) and his wife (Amy Adams).

programme.title: A Most Wanted Man, (2014, Thriller)
programme.desc: Phillip Seymour Hoffman stars in this action-thriller from spymaster John Le Carre. German and U.S. intelligence agencies race to uncover the identity of a mysterious man.

programme.title: Basic Instinct, (1992, Thriller)
programme.desc: San Francisco detective Nick Curran is investigating the murder of a once-celebrated rock star, and he's made a few unsettling discoveries: a bloody ice pick, a white silk scarf tied to a bedpost, and evidence of an otherwise romantic evening.

programme.title: Swingers, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: In this laugh-out-loud indie comedy classic that launched the careers of its outstanding cast, two friends set out to rewrite modern dating from Los Angeles to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Necessary Roughness, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: The Texas State Armadillos are fourth down and nowhere-to-go after a corruption scandal nearly ends the football program. Now upstanding coach Ed Gennero (Hector Elizondo) must put together a brand-new team.

programme.title: Kingpin, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: A star bowler whose career was prematurely "cut off" hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches.

programme.title: Swingers, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: In this laugh-out-loud indie comedy classic that launched the careers of its outstanding cast, two friends set out to rewrite modern dating from Los Angeles to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Flirting with Disaster, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: From the director of AMERICAN HUSTLE and SILVER LININGS PLAYBOOK comes this clever comedy with an all-star cast that examines dysfunctions of modern family life.

programme.title: Necessary Roughness, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: The Texas State Armadillos are fourth down and nowhere-to-go after a corruption scandal nearly ends the football program. Now upstanding coach Ed Gennero (Hector Elizondo) must put together a brand-new team.

programme.title: Kingpin, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: A star bowler whose career was prematurely "cut off" hopes to ride a new prodigy to success and riches.

programme.title: Swingers, (1996, Comedy)
programme.desc: In this laugh-out-loud indie comedy classic that launched the careers of its outstanding cast, two friends set out to rewrite modern dating from Los Angeles to Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Harder They Come, (1972, Action)
programme.desc: Reggae legend Jimmy Cliff stars as Ivan Martin, an aspiring singer hoping to make a name for himself. Robbed of his money and possessions, he finds work with a self-righteous preacher

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever, (1976, Music)
programme.desc: John Travolta performs as the troubled Tony Manero - Brooklyn paint store clerk by day and undisputed king of the dance floor by night. A powerful and provocative urban tragedy that carries as much significance today as it did in 1977.

programme.title: North Dallas Forty, (1979, Comedy)
programme.desc: In a society in which major league sporting events have replaced Sunday worship as the religion of choice, North Dallas Forty appears like a desecration at the altar.

programme.title: Semi-Tough, (1977, Comedy)
programme.desc: Barbara Jane (Jill Clayburgh), Billy Clyde (Burt Reynolds) and Shake (Kris Kristofferson) have been best friends for years. But when Barbara Jane's new interest in Shake turns into love, Billy Clyde realizes she's the woman he’s wanted all along!

programme.title: The End, (1978, Dark Humor & Black Comedies)
programme.desc: When Sonny (Burt Reynolds) is diagnosed with a fatal disease, he swallows a bottle of pills to end it all! Instead, he ends up in a loony bin beside the demented Marlon (Dom DeLuise) who is eager to help Sonny succeed...one madcap attempt at a time!

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever, (1976, Music)
programme.desc: John Travolta performs as the troubled Tony Manero - Brooklyn paint store clerk by day and undisputed king of the dance floor by night. A powerful and provocative urban tragedy that carries as much significance today as it did in 1977.

programme.title: Death Wish, (1974, Action)
programme.desc: In this explosive story of revenge and urban violence, Charles Bronson plays Paul Kersey, a bleeding-heart liberal who has a change of opinion after his wife and daughter are violently attacked by a gang of thugs in their apartment.

programme.title: The Last Waltz, (1978, Documentary)
programme.desc: On Thanksgiving Day, 1976, The Band gave its farewell concert at Winterland in San Francisco. On hand to help say goodbye to this influential rock group were some of the most acclaimed Musicians of the late 1960s and '70s.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey searches for the card that permits him to enter the final battle, not realizing Bandit Keith has stolen it. As he struggles to accept the fact that Serenity will be blind forever, he receives help from a new friend!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Bandit Keith's Machine deck forces Joey to take the defensive, Joey mimics Keith's battle strategy to metalize his Red-Eyes Black Dragon! Is victory assured, or does the cheater Bandit Keith literally have one last card up his sleeve?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey challenges Yugi for the right to face Pegasus. In a battle between friends, a fierce match ensues between the two people who know each other's strategies and cards.
programme.sub-title: Best of Friends Best of Duelists, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi is shocked as Joey uses the Time Wizard card on him. It's the very same card Yugi gave Joey as a sign of friendship!
programme.sub-title: Best of Friends Best of Duelists, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi prepares for the ultimate battle against Pegasus with the souls of Grandpa, Kaiba, and Mokuba on the line.
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus punishes Yugi using the same Toon Deck and mind-reading abilities he used on Kaiba. As Pegasus turns Yugi's monsters against him, Yugi loses the will to battle. Will Pegasus capture Yugi's soul into a card, just like Kaiba?
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi has found a counter to Pegasus's mind-reading ability: Yugi switches back and forth between his two souls! Yugi is able to destroy Pegasus's Toon World, but the duel has just only begun. The next level of the deadly Shadow Game is about to start!
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 3

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi crumples under the power of the Shadow Game. His friends yell desperate encouragement, but their voices cannot penetrate the sphere of darkness. Yugi's chance at victory is slipping away, as is his life!
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 4

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus summons Relinquished, a fearsome monster that can consume Yugi's Duel Monsters! Yugi counters with… Kuriboh?
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 5

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi meets a mysterious Egyptian named Shadi who enters Yugi's mind with the Millennium Key. What are these Millennium Items, and do they hold the answer to the mystery behind the Shadow Games?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends return from the Duelist Kingdom only to meet a young girl named Rebecca who demands that Grandpa return Blue-Eyes White Dragon to her.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Rebecca mistakenly believes that Grandpa stole the Blue-Eyes White Dragon from her grandfather. Yugi must defend the Blue-Eyes White Dragon to teach her that it's not the power of the cards, but the heart that's in them that counts.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The two-faced Board of Directors of Kaiba Corporation trap Kaiba inside a virtual reality game. Mokuba recruits Yugi and Joey to free Kaiba from this ultimate game where losing equals death!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The quest for Kaiba continues with a little help from… Mai? But can YUGI and friends adapt to a virtual world where the rules and strategies keep changing every step of the way?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends rescue Kaiba, but they are still stuck in the game! The only exit is past a Five-Headed Dragon, but in the difficult duel, Joey, Mokuba, and Mailose all their life points!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Duke Devlin defeats Joey and humiliates him in public, forcing Yugi to challenge Duke to a duel. However, this will not be a Duel Monsters duel, but a new game named Dungeon Dice Monsters!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: In exchange for Joey's freedom, Yugi agrees to give up Duel Monsters forever if he loses. Unfamiliar with the rules, Yugi gets off to a rough start.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi uses his innate gaming skills to turn the tables on Duke, but Duke has one more rule to mention: All creatures take up territory on the grid-like board. With no room to summon any new monsters, Yugi's position is helpless!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Duke's all-powerful Orogoth The Relentless dices Yugi's entire cadre of monsters into shreds, Yugi only has one turn left before he loses all his heart points!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: An arcane fortune teller steals the Millennium Puzzle and Yugi must defeat him in a duel to win it back.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The mysterious menace controlling Bandit Keith shatters the Millennium Puzzle into pieces before setting the dueling arena ablaze. Can Yugi put the Millennium Puzzle back together and save the spirit before the entire room is engulfed in flames?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The origin of Duel Monsters is revealed. Using the magic of the Millennium Necklace, Egyptian historian Ishizu Ishtar shows Kaiba how Duel Monsters was played millenniums ago.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The spirit of the Millennium Puzzle realizes that his memories of ancient Egypt have faded, but Tea helps him uncover the mysteries of his past.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi learns that he was a powerful Pharaoh who saved the world five thousand years ago, and he must now save the world again.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey is cornered by a group of sinister Rare Hunters who force Joey into a duel. If he loses, the Rare Hunters get his precious Red-Eyes Black Dragon!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's time to master new rules and monsters; let the Battle City Tournament commence! In the first duel of the tournament, Yugi challenges the Rare Hunter to win back Joey's Red-Eyes Black Dragon.
programme.sub-title: Yugi Vs. Rare Hunter Part 1 - Battle City Begins

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi figures out the Rare Hunter's strategy to summon the almighty Exodia, but it's too late to stop him. The Rare Hunter already has four pieces of Exodia in his hand, and the fifth and final piece is on top of his deck.
programme.sub-title: Yugi Vs. Rare Hunter Part 2 - Up Against Exodia

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The psychic duelist Espa Roba defeats Rex Raptor as easy as a chumpasaurus, and Joey's next on his hit list. What chance does Joey have when Espa Roba has the telepathic ability to read all the cards in Joey's hand?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey discovers that Espa Roba's extrasensory perception was a hoax, that he's not yet free from Espa's mental manipulations.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The magician duelist Arkana transports Yugi to the world's most lethal dueling arena where the loser gets sent to the Shadow Realm. Yugi must win this duel or he'll lose much more than his Dark Magician.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's Dark Magician versus Dark Magician! However, while Yugi only controls one Dark Magician, Arkana has three residing in his deck. Though outnumbered, Yugi will never give up as long as he believes in the heart of the cards.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: To counter Arkana's Dark Magician, Yugi pulls a rabbit out of his hat: the Dark Magician Girl!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The trickster Weevil Underwood spins a web of lies to bait Joey into a lopsided duel.

programme.title: Boa Hancock's illness threatens to sabotage Luffy's rescue mission. However, the Snake Princess just can't say "no" to the rubber-man, so a plan to save Ace is quickly hatched.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: LOVE IS A HURRICANE! LOVE-LOVE HANCOCK

programme.title: While Luffy races to save Ace, Nami tries to survive life on Sky Island, and Franky dances up a snowstorm before making the switch from cola to tea!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! THE SCIENCE OF WEATHER AND THE MECHANICAL ISLAND

programme.title: Chopper narrowly avoids being served for dinner in a land inhabited by giant birds, and Sanji's refined tastes land him a role as a leading lady on the island of girlish hearts.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! AN ISLAND OF GIANT BIRDS AND A PINK PARADISE!

programme.title: Nico Robin finds herself trapped on the island of Tequila Wolf: a miserable land where children are forced to work as slaves. Elsewhere, Usopp tries to survive a run-in with a man-eating plant!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! BRIDGING THE ISLANDS AND VICIOUS VEGETATION!

programme.title: Zoro is held against his will by the pink-haired princess of bad vibes, Brook gets mistaken for the king of darkness, and Luffy continues to eat his way toward a reunion with Fire-Fist Ace!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! A NEGATIVE PRINCESS AND THE KING OF DEMONS!

programme.title: Luffy and Boa arrive at Impel Down, but only thirty-three hours remain until Ace's execution. To save him, the Snake Princess must find a way to hide Luffy during her full-body search!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A DEADLY INFILTRATION! THE UNDERWATER PRISON IMPEL DOWN

programme.title: Time is running out on Ace, so Luffy teams up with a scoundrel who's going to pieces trying to escape Impel Down. There's no love lost between the former foes, but they'd better work together if they want to survive.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A REUNION IN HELL?! THE MAN WHO ATE THE CHOP-CHOP FRUIT!

programme.title: Luffy must part ways with a priceless treasure map before Buggy the Clown agrees to lead him through the bloody tangle of Blade Trees and Spike Needle Grass that make up Impel Down's Crimson Hell!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: BREAK THROUGH THE CRIMSON HELL! BUGGY'S CHAOS-INDUCING PLAN

programme.title: Luffy and Buggy the Clown could end up as hippo food if they aren't careful in Impel Down's Wild Beast Hell. Of course, the rubber-man might find that a better fate than dealing with the prison's putrid warden!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE STRONGEST MAN IN THE PRISON! POISON MAN MAGELLAN APPEARS

programme.title: Luffy and his crew stumble upon a most peculiar village when they hitch a ride on a fire-breathing beetle. The natives are petrified of pirates, but they welcome the Straw Hats with open arms!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A SPECIAL PRESENTATION RELATED TO THE MOVIE / A GOLD LION'S AMBITION ON THE MOVE

programme.title: The citizens of Little East Blue throw in a feast in honor of the Straw Hats, but when the Amigo Pirates try to capture Boss the Beetle, Luffy and his crew will have to defend their new friends.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A SPECIAL PRESENTATION RELATED TO THE MOVIE / LITTLE EAST BLUE IN DANGER

programme.title: Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji prepare to do battle on behalf of Boss the Beetle, but Captain Largo of the Amigo Pirates counters with a deadly arsenal of nets to put the Straw Hat brawlers on lock down!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A SPECIAL PRESENTATION RELATED TO THE MOVIE / THE FIERCE ONSLAUGHT OF THE AMIGO PIRATES

programme.title: Luffy kicks into Second Gear for his rematch with Largo, and Nami leads the islanders as they lay waste to the Amigo Pirates. Boss the Beetle may be safe for now, but someone sinister lurks behind the scenes.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Special Presentation Related to the Movie/ The Battle is on! Luffy Vs. Largo

programme.title: Luffy struggles to stay a step ahead of a prison patrol made up of hungry lions and poisonous scorpions! Meanwhile, Ace spends what could be his final hours swapping stories with a pirate who hates pirates.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A WARLORD IN PRISON! JIMBEI, THE HONORABLE PIRATE

programme.title: While the guards struggle to squelch a violent prison uprising, Luffy and his fellow fugitives try to keep their cool in a level of Impel Down known as Starvation Hell!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: CHIEF GUARD SALDEATH'S TRAP! LEVEL 3-- STARVATION HELL

programme.title: Boa Hancock uses her ample assets to buy some private time for a clandestine chat with Ace. Meanwhile, Luffy needs help from a graceful friend to escape the jaws of a hungry Sphinx!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE UNLEASHED SWAN! A REUNION WITH BON CLAY

programme.title: Luffy and Bon are on the verge of reaching Level 4, but they didn't count on fighting a demonic, lightning-fast, devastatingly powerful Minotaur! To defeat this beast, they'll need help from a human candle and a deranged clown!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: WARDEN MAGELLAN'S STRATEGY / STRAW HAT ENTRAPMENT COMPLETED!

programme.title: Luffy narrowly avoids a deadly dip in the boiling pool of blood, only to find himself face to face with Warden Magellan. Meanwhile, outside the prison walls, the marine fleet prepares for Whitebeard's onslaught!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ALL FORCES HAVE GATHERED! THE BATTLE ON LEVEL 4, THE BURNING HEAT HELL

programme.title: Warden Magellan is a monster of a man with a penchant for poisoning prisoners. To rescue Ace, Luffy must go toe to toe with this toxic terror, but how do you defeat a foe who's deadly to the touch?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: MIGHT MAGELLAN! BON CLAY BUGS OUT

programme.title: Luffy's daring assault on the venomous warden of Impel Down leaves him struggling to stand up, but despite the lethal poison breaking down his body, the rubber-man kicks his rescue mission into Second Gear!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE SHOWDOWN HAS COME! LUFFY'S DESPERATE LAST ATTACK!

programme.title: While Luffy hovers perilously on the verge of death, Bon Clay embarks on a suicidal rescue mission plagued by sub-zero temperatures and bloodthirsty wolves with a supremely savage disposition!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: FOR HIS FRIEND! BON CLAY'S DEADLY RESCUE ATTEMPT

programme.title: No existing antidote can save Luffy from the poison coursing through his veins, yet Bon Clay refuses to give up. His final, fleeting hope is a mysterious miracle-worker rumored to have vanished into the Gates of Hell!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A PARADISE IN HELL / IMPEL DOWN LEVEL 5.5

programme.title: Bon is overjoyed to hear that Luffy is still alive, but his happiness quickly turns to shock when he learns that Ivan's agonizingly painful "Healing Hormones" will cost the rubber-man ten years of his life!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: LUFFY'S TREATMENT BEGINS / IVA'S MIRACULOUS POWER!

programme.title: Ace is scheduled to be executed in a matter of hours, and Luffy's still hovering on the verge of death. It will take a miracle to save them both, but Bon would rather die than give up on his friend!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: BELIEVE IN MIRACLES! BON CLAY'S CRIES FROM THE HEART

programme.title: Luffy miraculously survived his brush with death, but he's far too weak to finish rescuing Ace. Ivan is reluctant to lend a hormonal hand to the doomed rescue mission – until he learns of Luffy's lineage!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: LUFFY BACK IN ACTION! IVA BEGINS THE BREAKOUT PLAN!!

programme.title: The quest to rescue Ace tuckers out thanks to a blast of sleeping gas! Ivan's scissor-handed sidekick puts an end to nap time, but Luffy will have to join forces with a scar-faced foe from the past if he wants to complete his mission!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ACE'S CONVOY BEGINS / BATTLE ON THE LOWEST FLOOR, LEVEL 6!

programme.title: Luffy's desperate attempt to rescue Ace is bolstered by two powerful new allies: the murderous Crocodile and the honorable fishman Jinbei. Meanwhile, Ivan sparks a prison riot to create a diversion for the rubber-man.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE ULTIMATE TEAM IS FORMED / SHAKING IMPEL DOWN!

programme.title: Luffy and his gang of outlaws cause a commotion on Level Four, Blackbeard's arrival leads to the release of the prison's most feared inmate, and Ace gazes upon the great blue sky for what could be the very last time!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: EVEN MORE CHAOS! BLACKBEARD TEACH INVADES

programme.title: Ivan undergoes a curvaceous transformation to better battle sadistic Sadie, the commander of the Demon Guards. Meanwhile, Blackbeard and Shiryu head for a showdown on Level 1!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE DANGEROUS ENCOUNTER! BLACKBEARD AND SHIRYU OF THE RAIN!

programme.title: Luffy's bone-crushing battle with the Vice Warden of Impel Down is interrupted by the sudden appearance of Blackbeard. When the rubber-man hears what the warlord has to say – heads will roll!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: REFUSAL TO BE DEFEATED! SERIOUS HANNYABAL

programme.title: Even in Second Gear, Luffy is no match for Blackbeard's vortex, but the rubber-man rebounds by knocking out a Demon Guard with one ferocious pistol-punch. Elsewhere, Warden Magellan vows to finish Luffy once and for all!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: JET PISTOL OF ANGER! LUFFY VS. BLACKBEARD!

programme.title: Ace is to be executed in a matter of hours, and Magellan's toxic breath is singeing the back of Luffy's neck. Ivan uses a devastating Death Wink to buy some time, but the warden's Poison Hydra may be more than he can handle!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: STOP MAGELLAN! IVA'S ESOTERIC TECHNIQUE EXPLODES!

programme.title: Luffy dons a suit of waxy armor in preparation for his rematch with Warden Magellan. Outside the prison walls, Jimbei turns a door into a boat, so Crocodile and Buggy can commandeer an escape vessel!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: MAGELLAN'S TRICKY MOVE! A FOILED ESCAPE PLAN!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has stolen the golden death mask of Tutankhamen, the ancient Egyptian pharaoh known as the "boy king." However, when Lupin tries on the golden death mask he becomes possessed by an ominous curse.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Trans Europe Superexpress train has departed Venice and is headed to France. Onboard the Superexpress is crime boss Don Marcino's ill-gotten treasures. Can Lupin and his gang pull off the heist before the train reaches its destination?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin meets the grandson of master Ukiyoe artist, Toushusai Sharaku and learns that he has been switching his own works with his grandfather's originals. Unable to switch the last painting due to illness, he asks Lupin to switch it in his stead.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Fujiko have been invited to a party hosted by Marcel Dulane, a member of Paris' high society. However, the elegant party turns out to be a trap. Fujiko is taken hostage and Lupin, with a time-bomb belt strapped to his waist…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is in Monaco to race his new toy in the Monaco Grand Prix. Or so he thought. Lupin ends up losing both his money and race car in a fixed poker game at the casino.
programme.sub-title: Bet on the Monaco Grand Prix!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A rare bottle of Bordeaux, commissioned by Napoleon for his beloved wife, Josephine, is to be given to the President of the United States as a Christmas present.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A criminal gang has hidden a microfilm containing the manufacturing process for artificial diamonds, developed by NASA, in one of Inspector Zenigata's molars. Determined to get his hands on that microfilm, Lupin must capture Inspector Zenigata.
programme.sub-title: The Great Chase in San Francisco

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Forward Hees, the world's richest man, suddenly dies a mysterious death and leaves a large ruby to Fujiko in his will. After inheriting the ruby, Fujiko comes down with the same mysterious fever as Hees…
programme.sub-title: Big Adventure of the Caribbean Sea

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A Count challenges Lupin to steal a gemstone named Dracula's Tear from on board his airship, the Hendenburg. However, also on board the ship are several formidable detectives: Homes III, Detective Archer, Koojisuke Kaneda and Inspector Zenigata.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is suffering from Transformation Sickness, an illness that transforms him into a cruel, cold-blooded criminal at the stroke of midnight, and leaves him with no recollection of his murderous crime spree in the morning…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A small Arab nation has received a blackmail notice. Pay a $100 million or have their oil fields blown up. Lupin targets the money, but his plans are hindered when he finds out the culprits are using human bombs.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Black Panther, the world's largest emerald, gets its name from the black panther that appears inside it when a light shines on it at a particular angle. After capturing this one-of-a-kind emerald, Lupin hides it in a museum to retrieve it later…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Vault maker Marukin Safe Company is forced into bankruptcy after Lupin cracks open their impenetrable safes. To test his own skills, Marukin's son challenges Lupin to open a safe he has designed…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: While trying to snag General Hatler's prize medallion, which contains a fifty-carat ruby, Lupin inadvertently reels in Hatler's biggest secret, his toupee! An enraged General Hatler orders Lupin and his gang to be killed.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Upon returning to Japan, Goemon finds his master on the brink of death. Furthermore, Jinkuro, a fellow disciple, had stolen half of the scroll containing the Secret Arts of the Iga Ninja. Will Goemon be able to avenge his master?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen are in a remote area pursing a mysterious treasure, when they save a woman being chased by hoodlums. The woman invites the two back to her sister's manor, which is full of beautiful women…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A mysterious woman who claims to be Fujiko's aunt, gives Lupin an ultimatum: Find Marshal Rommel's lost gold or die! First, Lupin must decipher the location of the gold, written in ancient hieroglyphs.
programme.sub-title: A Witch in the Fourth Dimension

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The great thief Nezumi-Kozou Jirokichi IV appears before Goemon and reveals that their ancestors competed in the first International Thieves Championship together, but were defeated by Lupin's grandfather, Arsène Lupin…
programme.sub-title: The Phantom Thief Rat Boy Appears

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The warden of an African prison is holding Fujiko captive. Lupin and his gang infiltrate the prison and attempt to break Fujiko out, but they become the target of the Iron Lizards, robotic devices developed to chase down fugitives!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Linda, a beautiful dancer, has stolen Jigen's heart and a vengeful Meyer has taken Fujiko hostage. Believing the women they love are in danger and unaware that Linda and Meyer are working together, Lupin and Jigen are set up to kill each other…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: According to legend, a stamp named the Cinderella Shadow is said to make its owner a princess. Lupin and his gang pull off the heist, but a girl name Alice who also wants the stamp tags along. Will the little girl get her royal wish?
programme.sub-title: Where did the Cinderella Stamp Go?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has sent a notice declaring he will steal all the cash from every bank in Paris. Detective Melon, the granddaughter of Inspector Garimard, is chosen to catch Lupin alongside Inspector Zenigata.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has many secret techniques up his sleeve, and one of them is his Levitation Technique. In order to get their hands on this technique, a crime syndicate plots a dirty trick, where a fake Lupin tortures a man known as X8 and frames the real Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Inspector Zenigata get kidnapped and the two are forcibly conscripted into the Foreign Legion in Morocco. Lupin and Inspector Zenigata make a run for it, but not before they're shackled together at the neck.
programme.sub-title: The Wind in Morocco is Hot

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Beautiful Swedish twins, Latica and Anita, are engaged in a battle to the death over the Viking treasure map concealed on their backs. In disguise, Lupin learns the map's secret, but the map possesses an additional secret.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A hit has been ordered on Lupin and Puma, a formidable hitman who specializes in long-range attacks, is on his trail! Lupin takes his chances with a close range, one-on-one showdown against Puma, but the plan seemingly backfires and Lupin is shot…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Orion's Crown has been stolen and is up for grabs at a black-market auction. Lupin has his eyes on both the crown and the auction money, but first he must outsmart the other parties vying for the crown, including Fujiko.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A two-thousand-year-old casket has been excavated. Inside the casket is Camilla, a beautiful woman in a near-death state, holding a golden statuette of the Virgin Mary. Lupin attempts to steal the golden statuette, but things don't go as planned…
programme.sub-title: Lupin Who Turned into a Vampire

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and his gang are attending a party in Africa, waiting for an opportunity to snatch a rare black pearl. However, their plan goes awry when a gang of gorillas crashes the party and steals the black pearl.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Massive riches have been hidden inside Tsukikage Castle. Lupin and his gang must decipher a code to find out the whereabouts of this great treasure. Wii Lupin be able to locate the treasure before his rivals do?
programme.sub-title: Uncover the Secret of Tsukikage Castle

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen head to Mongolia in search of Genghis Khan's treasures. Meanwhile, Goemon is visiting his ancestor's grave to pay his respects when he encounters Fujiko, who is in search of Yoshitsune Minamoto's buried treasure.
programme.sub-title: The Hidden Gold of Genghis Khan

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The ICPO chief promises to erase Fujiko's criminal record in exchange for her cooperation in arresting Lupin. Up against an ego-bruised Inspector Zenigata and a determined Fujiko, have Lupin's heisting days come to an end?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Jigen sneak on board a ship smuggling diamonds. However, what they find on board are several thousand chickens! Lupin and his gang infiltrate the Hong Kong smuggling boss's lair where diamonds are being illicitly sold…
programme.sub-title: Diamonds Disappeared Under the Sky of Hong Kong

programme.title: Robocop, (2014, Science fiction)
programme.desc: In 2028 Detroit, when Alex Murphy (Joel Kinnaman) -- a loving husband, father and good cop -- is critically injured in the line of duty, the multinational conglomerate OmniCorp sees their chance for a part-man, part-robot police officer.

programme.title: The Crow, (1994, Action)
programme.desc: Visually stunning and action-packed, this hit movie, based on the comic book series, follows the return from the grave of a young rock guitarist who, along with his fiancée, is brutally killed by a ruthless gang of criminals.

programme.title: Ultraviolet, (2006, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Milla Jovovich, Cameron Bright Nick Chinlund and William Fichtner star in this theatrical set in the late 21st century, where some humans have been modified genetically by a vampire-like disease and the world is pushed to the brink of worldwide civil war.

programme.title: Universal Soldier, (1992, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A woman reporter discovers a Defense Department project to create androids from the bodies of Vietnam soldiers, to be then used as an elite anti-terrorism unit.

programme.title: Total Recall, (1990, Science fiction)
programme.desc: It's 2084 A.D. and Doug Quaid is haunted by recurring dreams about journeying to Earths closest planetary neighbor, Mars.

programme.title: Deep Impact, (1998, Science fiction)
programme.desc: When a couple of young astronomers discover an enormous comet on course to collide with Earth, the countdown to doomsday begins and the human race embarks on the fight for survival.

programme.title: The Core, (2003, Science fiction)
programme.desc: The Earth has stopped rotating because of a change in the planet's core temperature. To restore the normal temperature, astronauts must travel to the center and detonate a nuclear bomb before the core superheats and destroys all life on the surface.

programme.title: The Crow, (1994, Action)
programme.desc: Visually stunning and action-packed, this hit movie, based on the comic book series, follows the return from the grave of a young rock guitarist who, along with his fiancée, is brutally killed by a ruthless gang of criminals.

programme.title: Goin' South, (1978, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: JACK NICHOLSON plays Henry Moon, a third-rate outlaw, in this romantic comedy set in the 1860s.

programme.title: The White Buffalo, (1977, Action)
programme.desc: Charles Bronson and Will Sampson star as Wild Bill Hickok and Chief Crazy Horse in this one-of-a-kind western that finds both western legends braving the snowy wilderness in search of the demon that haunts them both, the fabled White Buffalo!

programme.title: Breakheart Pass, (1975, Drama)
programme.desc: As a train races through the Rocky Mountains, the passengers are being murdered! The only hope is John Deakin (Charles Bronson) who uncovers a secret that explodes in a torrent of shocking revelations, explosive brawls, and blazing gun battles.

programme.title: Doc, (1971, Drama)
programme.desc: Stacy Keach, Haris Yulin, and Faye Dunaway give riveting performances in this controversial and myth-shattering reexamination of the darker side of gunslinger Doc Holliday and the actions that led to the infamous showdown in Tombstone, Arizona.

programme.title: Billy Two Hats, (1974, Drama)
programme.desc: Archie (Gregory Peck) and his partner, Billy (Desi Arnaz, Jr.) are bandits by trade, staging daring robberies throughout the American frontier. But when their latest heist takes a deadly turn, they are pursued by a ruthless marshal (Jack Warden).

programme.title: Rage at Dawn, (1955, Action)
programme.desc: A special agent from Chicago is sent out west to bring in the notorious Reno brothers.

programme.title: The Cowboy and the Lady, (1938, Drama)
programme.desc: A lonely socialite masquerades as a maid and meets an unpretentious, plain-spoken cowboy who is unaware of her true identity.

programme.title: The Painted Hills, (1951, Action)
programme.desc: Lassie comes to the rescue when a boy's life is put at risk by the greed inflamed by a gold strike.

programme.title: The Last Round-Up, (1947, Drama)
programme.desc: Gene Autry is a cattle rancher determined to protect the interests of neighboring ranchers and Indians against unscrupulous land manipulators when local authorities plan to build an aqueduct.

programme.title: Fort Yuma, (1955, Drama)
programme.desc: When a revered Apache chief is brutally murdered en route to Fort Yuma to negotiate a peace treaty, all-out war erupts in this rousing -- and surprisingly touching -- western starring Peter Graves and directed by the legendary Lesley Selander.

programme.title: Saving Silverman, (2001, Comedy)
programme.desc: Darren, Wayne and J.D. have been inseparable since grade school. However, their friendship is put to the test when Darren meets Judith, a young lady with the looks of an angel and the demeanor of the devil himself.

programme.title: The Longest Yard, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: The story of a pro quarterback and former college champion and coach are asked to put together a football team of inmates to take on the guards while doing their time in prison.

programme.title: The Fighting Temptations, (2003, Musical)
programme.desc: To collect his aunt's inheritance, an unemployed man (Cuba Gooding Jr.) must form a gospel choir and lead it to success.

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance, (2000, Romance)
programme.desc: A disillusioned war veteran, Rannulph Junah, agrees to play a game of golf. He finds the game futile until his caddy, Bagger Vance, teaches him the secret of the authentic golf stroke.

programme.title: The Longest Yard, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: The story of a pro quarterback and former college champion and coach are asked to put together a football team of inmates to take on the guards while doing their time in prison.

programme.title: The Fighting Temptations, (2003, Musical)
programme.desc: To collect his aunt's inheritance, an unemployed man (Cuba Gooding Jr.) must form a gospel choir and lead it to success.

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance, (2000, Romance)
programme.desc: A disillusioned war veteran, Rannulph Junah, agrees to play a game of golf. He finds the game futile until his caddy, Bagger Vance, teaches him the secret of the authentic golf stroke.

programme.desc: The story of a pro quarterback and former college champion and coach are asked to put together a football team of inmates to take on the guards while doing their time in prison.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Hotaru tries to avoid Chibi-Usa out of fear that her other personality will bring harm. Undaunted, Chibi-Usa invites Hotaru to go on a picnic.
programme.sub-title: Sunny Skies After a Storm: A Friendship Dedicated to Hotaru

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Shun Hayase is a high school athlete who sets a new national record in the men's high jump after overcoming health issues as a child.
programme.sub-title: Higher and Stronger: A Cheer from Usagi

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: A freak accident caused by Mimete results in Hotaru's house getting pulled into a dimensional rift, with Hotaru and Chibi-Usa trapped inside.
programme.sub-title: Battle Inside the Demonic Space: The Sailor Guardians' Gamble

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and her friends visit a new planetarium, which has opened in the Juban District. Mimete attacks with Daimon u Choten.
programme.sub-title: The Messiah of Silence Awakens? Stars of Destiny

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and her friends sneak into Mugen Academy in search of Hotaru, who has gone missing.
programme.sub-title: An Invasion from Another Dimension: Mystery of Mugen Academy

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: A new variety of flower called Tellun is being sold at a flower shop in the Juban District.
programme.sub-title: A Bewitching Flower That Steals Hearts: Tellu, the Third Witch

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and the others sneak into the practice examination site of the Mugen Academy. They meet Yui Bido who takes an interest in Ami's intelligence.
programme.sub-title: Believe in Love: Ami, the Kindhearted Guardian

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Cyprine manages to steal pure hearts from the students of Mugen Academy. Kaolinite takes notice of Chibi-Usa's power and kidnaps her!
programme.sub-title: Shadow of Destruction: The Messiah of Silence Awakens

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The revived Mistress 9 attempts to call Pharaoh 90, an energy life-form from another dimension, to Earth.
programme.sub-title: The Coming Terror of Darkness: Struggle of the Eight Guardians

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Hotaru’s and Mistress 9’s consciousnesses engage in a fierce battle. Sailor Moon gives up the Holy Grail to Souichi Tomoe to save Hotaru’s heart.
programme.sub-title: The Shining Shooting Star: Saturn and the Messiah

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Following the fight with Pharaoh 90, Usagi and her friends search for Hotaru in the ruins of Mugen Academy.
programme.sub-title: A New Life: Parting of the Stars of Destiny

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The Door of Space and Time is opened, allowing Chibi-Usa to return to the future.
programme.sub-title: A Guardian's Realization: Strength Lies Within a Pure Heart

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa follows a beautiful light into the forest. The owner of that light is Pegasus and he asks Chibi-Usa to keep their meeting a secret.
programme.sub-title: Meeting of Destiny: The Night Pegasus Dances

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: In order to capture Pegasus as their first step in world conquest, Zirconia orders her subordinates to seek out people with beautiful dreams.
programme.sub-title: Super Transformation Once Again: Pegasus's Power

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Having a taste for older woman, Hawk's Eye sets his sights on Usagi's mother, Ikuko.
programme.sub-title: Protect Mom's Dream: Double Moon's New Attack

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Tiger’s Eye approaches Naru in a plot to capture Pegasus in a subspace cage invented by Hawk’s Eye.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Two of Mamoru’s friends from college, Saori and Kobayashi, pay him a visit at his apartment in the hopes of meeting his girlfriend Usagi.
programme.sub-title: The Perfect Couple: Usagi and Mamoru's Love

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Mamoru is helping Usagi and Chibi-Usa with their studies when Luna and Artemis walk in, having a huge fight.
programme.sub-title: Artemis is Cheating? Enter the Mysterious Kitten

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The girls learn that Tomoko Takase, author of the best-selling book The Moon Night Pegasus, used to be Makoto's classmate from her previous school.
programme.sub-title: Makoto's Friendship: The Girl Who Admired Pegasus

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Tiger's Eye hatches a plan to capture Pegasus by using a Lemures that can enter other people's shadow and control them from within.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: A small fire incident leaves Mamoru's apartment in a total mess, forcing him to stay at Rei's place for the time being.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa bumps into a young man after becoming enthralled in a beautiful illustration book she had Usagi buy for her.
programme.sub-title: Forest of Illusion: A Beautiful Fairy's Invitation

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Ami is shocked when she sees Mamoru coming out of his apartment with another woman.
programme.sub-title: Drive to the Heavens: The Dream Car Fueled with Love

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa befriends Miharu, who is aiming to be the best swordwoman in Japan.
programme.sub-title: Aiming for the Top: The Pretty Swordswoman's Dilemma

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Yoshiki Usui’s new store opens. Usagi and her friends head out to see the fashion show, along with Fish’s Eye, who is captivated by Usui's good looks.
programme.sub-title: We Love Fashion: The Stylish Guardians

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi spots Minako out on a date with a handsome man. To everyone's surprise, the boyfriend is different from the one Usagi saw earlier.
programme.sub-title: Storm of Love: Minako's Grand Two-Timing Plan

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: An old woman named Mayako lives alone in a mansion. Mayako is very distrustful of strangers, believing they are after her wealth and fortune.
programme.sub-title: The Secret Mansion: A Menu of Love for You

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Reports of Pegasus attacking the town cause Usagi and the other Sailor Guardians to have doubts about whether Pegasus can be trusted or not.
programme.sub-title: Believe in Pegasus: The Four Guardians' Super Transformation

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and her friends are enjoying their summer vacation by the beach. Shingo is acting as their bodyguard—especially for Ami, whom he has a crush on.
programme.sub-title: Shining Summer Days: Ami Under the Sea-Breeze

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and Chibi-Usa see an ad for a free ballet lesson and sign up. As they practice, Fish’s Eye draws the class's attention with his dancing skills.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and Chibi-Usa meet a woman named Rubina who follows them. Rubina is a princess who snuck out to experience life outside of her royal duties.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and the girls attend the school festival. Makoto is asked to dance by a handsome man, who is actually Tiger's Eye in disguise.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Fish's Eye goes after Mamoru. But Mamoru seems to show no interest in being with anyone besides Usagi.
programme.sub-title: Shadow of Evil: The Trio's Last Chance

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 1, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A chain of events, set off by Edward and Bella's marriage, honeymoon and birth of a child, yields a shocking development for Jacob.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 2, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: Bella and Edward gather werewolves, vampires and other allies to help them protect their daughter from the Volturi.

programme.title: Let Me In, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A misfit boy (Kodi Smit-McPhee) suspects that his only friend (Chloë Grace Moretz), an eerie child who only appears at night, is hiding a terrible secret.

programme.title: The Girl With All the Gifts, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: In the future, a strange fungus has changed nearly everyone into a thoughtless, flesh-eating monster. When a scientist and a teacher find a girl who seems to be immune to the fungus, they all begin a journey to save humanity.

programme.title: Stir of Echoes, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: After being hypnotized at a party, a man (Kevin Bacon) has visions of deaths and of a girl who disappeared six months earlier.

programme.title: Frailty, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A boy tries to protect his brother after their seemingly normal father (Bill Paxton) goes on a killing spree.

programme.title: Uninvited Guest, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A screenwriter, his neglected wife and their guests become the prey of a deadly stranger who arrives on their doorstep.

programme.title: Regression, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A detective (Ethan Hawke) and a psychoanalyst (David Thewlis) uncover evidence of a satanic cult while investigating the rape of a traumatized teen (Emma Watson).

programme.title: Intrigo: Dear Agnes, (1970, Entertainment)
programme.desc: A young widow receives a shocking proposition when an old friend offers her money to kill her husband.

programme.title: The Couch Trip, (1988, Dark Humor & Black Comedies)
programme.desc: When asylum inmate John Burns (Dan Ackroyd) intercepts a call and impersonates his doctor, he agrees to be the host of a radio advice show and is soon spreading his offbeat psychobabble to ultra-trendy Angelenos in this outrageous comedy!

programme.title: Coneheads, (1993, Science fiction)
programme.desc: One look, and you know they're from a very strange place. They're from New Jersey, by way of France, by way of far-off, far-out Remulak. They're Coneheads.
